summary: Create a "shank" game where the shank eats apples.
architectural_notes: ZIP export flow should run automatically and provide the ZIP (and link) without interactive confirmation prompts.
known_issues: Build/deploy pipeline rejected domain name "\"shank-eats-apples\"-game" due to invalid characters; domain must be 5–50 chars and contain only letters, numbers, and hyphens.
User reports regression/UX issue: system keeps asking whether to generate ZIP instead of delivering it as requested.

existing_features.title: Create a playable browser game where the player controls a "shank" character that moves around a bounded playfield and eats apples to increase score and length/size (snake-like gameplay).
Implement core game rules and states: Start, Playing, Paused, and Game Over; include collision rules (wall/self collision) that trigger Game Over and a Restart flow.
Add controls and accessibility: keyboard controls (arrow keys and/or WASD) for movement, plus on-screen directional buttons suitable for mobile/touch.
Create a coherent retro-arcade visual theme (colors, typography, layout) and apply it consistently across the game screens (Start/Playing/Pause/Game Over), avoiding blue & purple as primary colors.
Add basic HUD elements: current score and best score (best score stored locally in the browser) displayed during gameplay and on Game Over.

Add the required generated images as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them in the UI (for the shank, apple, and optionally a background). Do not serve images from the backend.
Add a level system to the game with clear progression and increasing difficulty across multiple levels.
Implement per-level layouts by introducing impassable obstacle cells in the playfield and enforce collision rules against them.
Add selectable skins for the shank (and optionally the apple) with a simple selection UI and persistence in localStorage.
Update the playfield rendering to support level obstacles and skin-based sprite selection while keeping the existing retro-arcade visual style consistent.
Add a repeatable export flow that produces a single ZIP file containing a production-ready static build of the frontend game suitable for uploading to third-party sites (e.g., PlayStory).
Add end-user/developer documentation describing how to generate the ZIP locally, including the exact command(s) to run and where the ZIP output file is created.
Ensure the frontend provides a repeatable, one-command ZIP export flow that produces a single production-ready archive at frontend/export/shank-game.zip from the current static build.
Fix and complete the ZIP export documentation so users can generate the ZIP locally with exact commands and a clearly stated output location.
Make the latest production ZIP build available as a static downloadable file and provide a stable in-app download link to it.

Update the ZIP export automation to also produce (or copy) a deployable shank-game.zip into the built static output directory after the production build completes, without requiring manual file moves.
Fix the build/deploy pipeline configuration so the application domain name used for deployment is valid (5–50 characters, only letters, numbers, and hyphens) and does not include escaped quotes.
Remove any “confirm/ask-to-generate ZIP” step from the end-to-end build/export flow and ensure the production ZIP is always generated automatically as part of the build output.
Ensure the deployed static site always serves the latest ZIP at the stable path /shank-game.zip (copied into the static build output directory) on every production build.
Keep (or add if missing) a stable in-app ZIP download link that directly downloads /shank-game.zip with no intermediate dialogs, confirmations, or secondary pages.

new_feature_requests.summary: Build a game concept: a shank character that eats apples.
Add multiple levels with increasing difficulty/varied layouts.
Add selectable character skins (and possibly apple skins) for the shank game.
Generate an exported downloadable ZIP build of the game for uploading (e.g., to PlayStory/Play Store).
Prepare and provide a downloadable ZIP build link for the latest game build.
Automatically generate/provide the ZIP file (and download link if applicable) without prompting the user again.

projectName: Build a simple "Shank Eats Apples" arcade game
